Sentencas: The results of detailed studies of the kinetics of hydrogen oxidation on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-delta (SFM) electrode in contact with La0.85Sr0.15Ga0.85Mg0.15O3 electrolyte are presented for the first time.
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface

Sentencas: For a detailed understanding of the mechanism of the electrode reaction, studies were carried out in H-2+H2O+Ar gas mixtures at a constant partial pressure of hydrogen, water and at a constant hydrogen/water ratio.
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface

Sentencas: Also, to understand the pathways of the electrode reaction, the results of the comparison of the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation on the SFM electrode with different organisation of current probes to the studied electrode are presented, as well as a comparison of the kinetics of electrode reaction on the SFM electrode and the SFM electrode decorated with nickel particles.
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface

Sentencas: It is shown that the rate of hydrogen oxidation on the SFM electrode is determined by the low rate of oxygen heterogeneous exchange, as well as by the slow dissociation of hydrogen on the SFM surface.
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, the rates of these processes are comparable; with temperature decrease the rate of hydrogen oxidation is mainly limited by hydrogen dissociation.
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface

Sentencas: Decorating the SFM electrode with nickel particles significantly increases the rate of hydrogen dissociation and increases the activity of the electrode more than two-fold, up to a polarisation resistance of about 0.04 Omega cm(2) at 800 degrees C. (C) 2021
Titulo: Hydrogen oxidation kinetics on a redox stable electrode for reversible solid-state electrochemical devices: The critical influence of hydrogen dissociation on the electrode surface
